intro: Thymophylla setifolia var. setifolia, commonly known as the slender thymophylla, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, and it produces small, pink or white flowers in clusters. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
